intro: Lesquerella frigida, commonly known as the cold-weather lesquerella, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to the Arctic regions. It is a low-growing perennial plant that produces small, yellow flowers and has distinctive, pinnately divided leaves. The plant is adapted to harsh, cold climates and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. Its seeds contain high levels of erucic acid, making it valuable for industrial and agricultural applications. Due to its specialized habitat, Lesquerella frigida is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
